sentences: Victoria Loren Kelly (born December 14, 1992) is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and record producer.
section: N/A

sentences: Kelly first gained recognition after posting videos on YouTube as a teenager, and made it through to Hollywood week on the ninth season of American Idol in 2010.
section: N/A

sentences: Thereafter, she independently released her self-produced debut EP in 2012, Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2013, after Scooter Braun became her manager, Kelly signed with Capitol Records.
section: N/A

sentences: Her second EP and first major-label release, Foreword (2013), followed soon after.
section: N/A

sentences: Kelly's debut studio album Unbreakable Smile (2015) peaked at number two on the Billboard 200 chart in the United States with its lead single, "Nobody Love", marking her first appearance on the Billboard Hot 100 chart.
section: N/A

sentences: Kelly was nominated for Best New Artist at the 58th Grammy Awards, and voiced Meena in the animated film Sing (2016), which she reprises in the 2021 sequel, Sing 2.
section: N/A

sentences: Her second studio album Hiding Place (2018) peaked at number 35 on the Billboard 200 chart and received two Grammy Awards, for Best Gospel Album and Best Gospel Performance/Song, respectively.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2019, Kelly released her third studio album Inspired by True Events followed by her fourth studio album in 2020, A Tori Kelly Christmas which also marked her first Christmas album.
section: N/A
== Life and career ==

sentences: Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Early life and career beginnings ===
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Kelly was born in Wildomar, California.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Her father, Allwyn, is of Jamaican and Puerto Rican ancestry, while her mother, Laura, is of Irish and German descent.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She has a younger brother named Noah, born August 29, 1996.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Growing up, she was exposed to a variety of music by her parents.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: "I give them a lot of credit for just playing all different genres, and no genre was off limits," she said when asked about her upbringing.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Kelly is a Christian.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Faith plays a part in her songwriting, though she does not consider herself a part of the Christian music genre.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Kelly appeared on the show Star Search, but lost to vocalist Tiffany Evans, who won the title of Junior Champion in the junior singer division.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2004, she participated on America's Most Talented Kids, singing Christina Aguilera's "Keep on Singin' My Song" and won, beating out musician Hunter Hayes.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She made a second appearance on the show in the Tournament of Champions, but lost to Antonio Pontarelli, a rock musician.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: At age twelve, Kelly accepted a record deal with Geffen Records, but both sides agreed to end the contract due to creative differences.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2007, Kelly began posting videos to YouTube, at the age of 14.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: The first video she uploaded was a cover of John Wesley Work Jr.'s "Go Tell It on the Mountain", which she originally performed back in December 2004.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Kelly gained recognition for her acoustic cover, with a fellow YouTuber named Angie Girl, of Frank Ocean's "Thinkin Bout You".
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Despite failing to reach the top 24 on American Idol, she took a new tack in her music, learning how to play the guitar, composing original song pieces, and recording them herself on her computer.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Tori began posting her performances on YouTube, and quickly reached over 1,000,000 subscribers.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword =
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===
== Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: In 2010, Tori auditioned for Season 9 of American Idol in Denver, Colorado and made it through to Hollywood Week but did not reach the "Top 24" of the artists.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: She had claimed that 'she was devastated' but she had 'given it her all'.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Afterwards, she was asked to take part in a youth version of the 1985 charity song "We Are the World" titled "We Are the World: The Next Generation".
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: On May 1, 2012, she released her first EP, titled Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly, which was released on her own label, Toraay Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Kelly wrote, produced, engineered, and recorded the EP by herself in her bedroom.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Shortly after its release, the EP made it to the Top 10 Pop Albums list on iTunes.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: She called the EP a "warm up" to a full-length album that was to come in the future.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: As of 2013, it had sold more than 14,000 copies and reached number nine on the US Heatseekers Albums chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: In February 2013, Kelly released a single called "Fill a Heart", which she wrote for the "Child Hunger Ends Here" campaign by ConAgra Foods and Feeding America.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: The song was later performed by British boy band The Wanted on Dancing With the Stars.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Starting in April 2013, Kelly performed at eight venues across continental U.S. for her "Fill a Heart" tour, helping out at the cities' food banks during the day.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: She has performed in venues such as the Troubador and the Roxy in Los Angeles, the Gramercy Theater in New York and Bush Hall in London.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: She has also been featured in magazines such as Teen Vogue, Elle and Glamour.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: During mid-2013, Kelly's newly assigned manager Scooter Braun introduced her to the heads of Capitol Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: She had been "very skeptical" about signing with a major record label in fear that things would not work out in her favor.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: "I'd been burned before.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: But when I met those guys, I had never felt that way: They were fans and really got me."
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: On September 6, 2013, she was signed to Capitol Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: In September 2013, she was picked as Elvis Duran's Artist of the Month and was featured on NBC's Today show hosted by Kathie Lee Gifford and Hoda Kotb, where she performed live her single "Dear No One".
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Kelly announced on The Today Show that her major label debut, a second EP, titled Foreword, would be released on October 22, 2013, on Capitol Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: By the end of November the EP had sold more than 16,000 copies, debuting at number 16 on the US Billboard 200.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Kelly was the sole supporting act to Ed Sheeran at Madison Square Garden on November 1, 2013, and supported Sam Smith on their In the Lonely Hour UK tour in October 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Kelly wrote and recorded a song called "Silent" for The Giver: Music Collection, supporting the film adaptation (The Giver) of the novel The Giver, which was released on iTunes on August 5, 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: On August 7, 2014, Kelly posted a live acoustic version of the song on her YouTube channel; which has over 2.6 million views as of October 2015.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Kelly was featured on "Lullaby" by British rapper Professor Green, which was released in the United Kingdom on September 14, 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: The song peaked at number four on the UK Singles Chart, thus providing Kelly with her first top ten song in the United Kingdom.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Kelly was featured on the medley "Winter Wonderland"/"Don't Worry Be Happy" on Pentatonix's album That's Christmas to Me that was released in October 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: On December 1, 2014, it was announced that Tori Kelly was one of MTV's Artist's To Watch.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: She privately performed two songs for MTV: "Funny" and "Dear No One"; both can be found on her Artist To Watch page.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Her "Funny" performance was aired on MTV for several weeks.
section: == Life and career == | === 2010–2014: Handmade Songs by Tori Kelly and Foreword ===

sentences: Throughout 2014, Kelly worked with Braun on her debut album in which she had contributions from Toby Gad, Max Martin, and Ed Sheeran.

sentences: The lead single from the album, "Nobody Love", was released on February 8, 2015.

sentences: It was written by Rickard Goransson, Max Martin, and Tori Kelly herself.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: Kelly performed "Nobody Love" at the 2015 Billboard Music Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: The album, entitled Unbreakable Smile, was released on June 23, 2015, and debuted at number two on the Billboard 200.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: Kelly performed "Should've Been Us" at the 2015 MTV Video Music Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: In October 2015, Kelly covered the song "Colors of the Wind" from Pocahontas on the We Love Disney album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: "Hollow" was released on October 22, 2015 as the first single from the new edition of Unbreakable Smile.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: In the same month, Kelly became the brand-ambassador of William Rast, the clothing line co-founded by Justin Timberlake.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: In late 2015, Kelly received a nomination for Best New Artist at the 58th Grammy Awards.

sentences: She performed at the ceremony with English singer James Bay.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: She became the first artist in history to perform a Christian pop song at the Grammy Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: Kelly recorded an updated version of Amy Grant's 1991 single "Baby Baby", with Grant herself.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: Commemorating its 25th anniversary, when Kelly was still 23, the song was released on April 29, 2016.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: Kelly made her cinematic debut in the animated movie Sing (2016), voicing Meena the elephant.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: On July 10, 2016, Kelly released an original song "Blink of an Eye" to honor her friend Christina Grimmie, on the one-month anniversary of her killing during a meet and greet at The Plaza Live in Orlando, Florida, on June 10, 2016, while on tour with Before You Exit.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Unbreakable Smile and other projects ===

sentences: On May 7, 2017, Kelly played the Beale Street Music Festival in Memphis, Tennessee opening for Soundgarden at what would be one of their final performances before frontman Chris Cornell committed suicide on May 17.

sentences: On June 9, Kelly and rapper Lecrae, released the single "I'll Find You", with Kelly as the featured artist.

sentences: The accompanying music video was released on July 28, 2017.

sentences: It features various St. Jude Hospital patients, and Kelly and Lecrae singing over a black backdrop.

sentences: It peaked at No. 11 on the Billboard R&B/Hip-Hop chart, No. 1 on the Hot Christian Songs and No. 17 on the Billboard Bubbling Under Hot 100 chart.
